TopicTitle: I may have discovered how to map the Mun community wide.

Articles.Content: I was thinking something like Google Earth, where we have an interactive 3d globe of the Mun and Kerbin. Players could submit landmarks in the form of place indicating thumb tacks where a moderator would approve or deny them. You would have to have landed there to supply coordinates to prove that you deserve the name. I\'m not sure what site we could use for this, but if anyone has any suggestions, that\'d be great.
That would be awesome. Maybe make a new tab on the website for it. I mean, Unity is browser-friendly, right?
Or maybe we can convince Google to make 'Google Kerbin'. I have a friend that plays KSP who\'s father is very high up in google.
Both ideas sound great. We can start brainstorming ideas for a website for a Kerbin and Mun interactive globe. I\'ll look up some things right now.

Or we can just try to convince Google that having Google Kerbin = more visitors = more people look at ads = ??? = Profit

BTW, I dont know what goes in the ???. i thought it made it look good

Or we can just try to convince Google that having Google Kerbin = more visitors = more people look at ads = ??? = Profit

BTW, I dont know what goes in the ???. i thought it made it look good

Don\'t forget Google Mun.

https://developers.google.com/maps/

I was thinking about this a few months ago, but forgot about it, look at the google maps api, you can\'t do 3d maps with it, but you can do something along this line of things.

http://www.uesp.net/maps/mwmap/mwmap.shtml
